clues.text: The Teamsters union is formally called an "International" one of these
Woodrow Wilson lived to see this organization grow out of the last of his 14 Points
A mountain pass is home to the "Christ the Redeemer of the Andes" statue, symbolizing peace between these 2 countries
The E that's "packaged" in this organization's acronym used to stand for Europe; now it stands for everywhere
Habitat for Humanity's program of short-term international trips is called "Global" this

rounds.comments: (Ken: The letter N will appear four times in each correct response.)

clues.text: Number of "beers on the wall" at the beginning of the song
"U" know it means not deliberate; I'm sorry, that slip of the tongue was completely this
It's the church festival on March 25 commemorating what Gabriel told Mary
Adjective preceding the railroad completed in 1869
Inopportune or untimely, like the title "Woman" in a Dominick Dunne novel

On "The Simpsons", this cat gets second billing on his TV show where "they fight! & bite! &
Fight & fight & bite!"
On June 19, 1978... ugh, a Monday... this tubby tabby introduced himself & "my cartoonist, Jon" to the masses
If you know Mr. Bigglesworth is the pet of this character in a 1997 film, we'll give you... one million... uh, $600
This character made petting a white Persian quite ominous in "You Only Live Twice"
Jennifer Hudson sang of being "all alone in the moonlight" in this role in 2019's "Cats"
They're the first 5 words of the Psalm
"He maketh me to lie down in green pastures: he leadeth me beside" these
These 2 items, "they comfort me"
"Thou preparest a table before me in the presence of" these
"Surely" these 2 qualities "shall follow me all the days of my life"
Having bibimbap? Try this, a type of Korean banchan, or side dish; the name once referred to a method of fermentation
The animated Sylvester the cat had the catchphrase, "sufferin"' this, actually a side dish featuring lima beans
Try a simple salad of tomatoes & this rich, soft cheese with a name that means "buttered" in Italian
A summer side is elote, Mexican-style this veggie, rolled in butter & mayo & sprinkled with Cotija cheese & lime
Try sauteeing these green leaves of the taro plant to go with your jerk chicken; it's also the name of a soup using the greens
A 14th century addition, it came from a little extra ornamentation of the "I"
The 15th letter in our alphabet, this vowel's from the 15th letter in the Greek alphabet
A Latin link of 2 letters pronounced as one is why we, in modern English, always follow this letter with U
An Anglo-Saxon rune was replaced by this letter that's twice one of its predecessors
Latin mostly abandoned this letter, from the Semitic symbol for an open hand, in favor of the "C"
Jasper Johns' "Sketch for 'Good Time Charley"' can be found at this museum, 1000 5th Ave. at 82nd
In 1877 the Bolshoi first danced this ballet about a prince who falls for a were-bird
The witch of this biblical place pops up in Carl Nielsen's opera "Saul and David"
This composer's 1869 waltz "Wine, Women and Song" was far from junior league
Sienese painter Simone Martini painted a portrait of this poet's love Laura, but, alas, it's been lost
A traditional Scotsman wears a purse called a sporran at the front of this garment
Sometimes it's a narrow, close-fitting dress & sometimes it's a holder for a sword
LBD is short for this, a wardrobe staple in women's closets
This fur of a weasel that turns white in winter has been seen on royal raiment for centuries
A chapel de fer was a battle helmet made from this metal
An autumn dance reception area
Feeble Athenian stream
Superlative visitor leisure
A warning that some of the T's & button-downs are grimy
Weighty Camaro tax
The moral of his town & country mice fable is that a simple, peaceful life is better than riches with unease
In his "Analects", this Asian thinker was among those who suggested not to do to others what you don't want done to you
Simple machine of which Archimedes said that with the right place to stand he could move the world
Completes the Hippocratic injunction "to help, or at least, to do..."
In his "Meditations" this stoic Roman emperor wrote, "Every instant of time is a pinprick of eternity"
On your Kentucky veranda, you'll sip this bourbon, sugar & crushed ice drink that's garnished with an aromatic herb
This "worldly" drink consists of vodka, orange-flavored liqueur, cranberry juice & lime juice
Perfect for summer is a bikini martini--gin, peach schnapps & the blue type of this liqueur
This cocktail of whiskey, sweet vermouth & a cherry sounds like Peter Minuit paid $24 for it & at a fancy bar, he might
Rye, bitters, Pernod, sugar & a twist gets you this Crescent City cocktail
Jack Black fronted & provided tutelage to this young band, also a 2003 movie title
Stillwater, fronted by Jason Lee, rocks this movie
This movie covers the rise of the One-ders, later The Wonders
The New Main Street Singers, Mitch & Mickey & The Folksmen are groups in this Christopher Guest film
In a 1984 film, Peter Weller is this lead singer backed by the Hong Kong Cavaliers

rounds.text: In 1992 Jean Polly told new web users to do this & later explained they "need some skill... never know if there are going to be sharks"
